1.verse: That which has existed from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we looked upon and our hands have touched, concerning the word of life—

2.verse: this life was revealed, and we have seen it and are bearing witness and proclaiming to you the eternal life that existed with the Father and was revealed to us—

3.verse: that which we have seen and heard we proclaim also to you, so that you too may have fellowship with us; and indeed our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ.

4.verse: These things we are writing that our joy may be complete.

5.verse: Now this is the message that we have heard from him and are proclaiming to you: God is light, and there is absolutely no darkness in him.

6.verse: If we say that we have fellowship with him but continue to walk in darkness, we lie and are not putting the truth into practice.

7.verse: But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.

8.verse: If we say that we are without sin, we are deceiving ourselves and the truth is not in us.

9.verse: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

10.verse: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar and his word is not in us.

1.verse: My little children, I am writing these things to you so that you may not sin. But if anyone does sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous one.

2.verse: He is the propitiation for our sins, and not for ours only, but also for those of the entire world.

3.verse: Now this is how we can be sure that we know God: if we keep his commandments.

4.verse: The one who says, “I know God,” yet does not keep his commandments, is a liar and the truth is not in him.

5.verse: But whoever keeps his word, truly in that person is the love of God brought to fulfillment. This is how we can be sure that we are in him:

6.verse: the one who claims to abide in God ought to walk just as Jesus walked.

7.verse: Dear friends, it is not a new commandment that I write to you, but an old commandment—one that you have had from the beginning. The old commandment is the message you have already heard.

8.verse: Yet it is a new commandment that I write to you, one that is true in him and in you, because the darkness is passing away and the true light is already shining.

9.verse: The one who claims to be in the light but goes on hating his brother is still in the darkness.

10.verse: The one who loves his brother is living in the light and in him there is no cause for stumbling.

11.verse: But the one who hates his brother is in the darkness; he walks in the darkness and does not know where he is going, because the darkness has blinded his eyes.

12.verse: I am writing to you, my children, because your sins are forgiven on account of his name.

13.verse: I am writing to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning. I am writing to you, young men, because you have overcome the evil one.

14.verse: I have written to you, my children, because you know the Father. I have written to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning. I have written to you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God abides in you, and you have overcome the evil one.

15.verse: Do not love the world or the things in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

16.verse: For all that is in the world—the desire of the flesh, the desire of the eyes, the pride of possession—is not from the Father but from the world.

17.verse: The world is passing away with all its desires, but the one who does the will of God remains for all time.

18.verse: My children, it is the last hour! And just as you heard that the Antichrist would come, even now many antichrists have appeared. Therefore we know that it is the last hour.

19.verse: They went out from us but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would have continued with us. But they went out from us that it might become plain that none of them are of us.

20.verse: But you have an anointing from the Holy One, and you all know the truth.

21.verse: I write to you, not because you do not know the truth, but because you do know it and because no lie comes from the truth.

22.verse: Who is the liar but the one who denies that Jesus is the Christ? This one is the Antichrist, the one who denies the Father and the Son.

23.verse: No one who denies the Son has the Father. The one who confesses the Son has the Father also.

24.verse: Let what you heard from the beginning abide in you. If what you heard from the beginning abides in you, then you will abide in the Son and in the Father.

25.verse: And this is the promise that he made to us—eternal life.

26.verse: I have written these things to you concerning those who are trying to deceive you.

27.verse: But the anointing you received from him abides in you, and you have no need that anyone teach you. But as his anointing teaches you about all things, and is true and not a lie, just as it has taught you, abide in him.

28.verse: And now, dear children, abide in him, so that when he appears we may have confidence and not be put to shame in his presence when he comes.

29.verse: If you know that he is righteous, you also know that everyone who practices righteousness has been born of him.

1.verse: See what great love the Father has given to us, that we should be called children of God—and so we are! The reason the world does not know us is that it did not know him.

2.verse: Dear friends, at the present time we are children of God, and it has not yet been revealed what we will be. But we do know that when he is revealed we will be like him, because we will see him just as he is.

3.verse: And everyone who has this hope in him purifies himself, just as he is pure.

4.verse: Everyone who makes a practice of sinning is also breaking the law; indeed, sin is lawlessness.

5.verse: And you know that he appeared to take away our sins, and that there is no sin in him.

6.verse: No one who abides in him keeps on sinning; no one who continues to sin has either seen him or known him.

7.verse: Little children, let no one deceive you. Whoever makes it a practice to do what is right is righteous, just as he is righteous.

8.verse: The one who continues to sin is of the devil, because the devil has been sinning from the beginning. The Son of God appeared for this purpose—that he might destroy the works of the devil.

9.verse: No one born of God makes a practice of sinning, because God’s seed abides in him. He cannot keep on sinning, because he has been born of God.

10.verse: By this the children of God and the children of the devil are revealed: whoever does not practice righteousness is not of God, nor is the one who does not love his brother.

11.verse: For this is the message that you heard from the beginning: that we should love one another.

12.verse: We are not to be like Cain who was of the evil one and murdered his brother. And why did he murder him? Because his own deeds were evil and those of his brother were righteous.

13.verse: So do not be surprised, brothers, if the world hates you.

14.verse: We know that we have crossed over from death to life, because we love the brothers. Whoever does not love remains in the realm of death.

15.verse: Everyone who hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life abiding in him.

16.verse: By this we have come to know love: that he laid down his life on our behalf. And we are obligated to lay down our lives for the brothers.

17.verse: But whoever has this world’s resources and sees his fellow Christian in need yet closes his heart against him, how does the love of God abide in him?

18.verse: Little children, let us love, not in word or speech but in action and truth.

19.verse: And by this we will know that we are of the truth and will set our conscience at rest in his presence,

20.verse: that if our conscience condemns us, that God is greater than our conscience and knows all things.

21.verse: Dear friends, if our conscience does not condemn us, we have confidence in the presence of God,

22.verse: and whatever we ask we receive from him, because we keep his commandments and do what is pleasing in his sight.

23.verse: And this is his commandment: that we believe in the name of his Son Jesus Christ and love one another, just as he gave us the commandment.

24.verse: And the one who keeps his commandments resides in him, and he in him. And by this we know that he abides in us: by the Spirit whom he has given to us.

1.verse: Dear friends, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits to find out whether they are from God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.

2.verse: This is how you can recognize the Spirit of God: every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is from God,

3.verse: but every spirit that does not confess Jesus is not from God. This is the spirit of the Antichrist, which you heard was coming, and now is already in the world.

4.verse: Little children, you have been born of God and have overcome them, because the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.

5.verse: They are of the world; therefore they speak from the world’s perspective and the world listens to them.

6.verse: We are from God. The person who knows God listens to us, but whoever is not from God does not listen to us. By this we know the Spirit of truth and the spirit of error.

7.verse: Dear friends, let us love one another, because love is from God, and everyone who loves has been born of God and knows God.

8.verse: The person who does not love does not know God, because God is love.

9.verse: By this the love of God is revealed to us: that God has sent his one and only Son into the world so that we might live through him.

10.verse: In this is love, not that we have loved God but that he loved us and sent his Son as a propitiation for our sins.

11.verse: Dear friends, if God loved us like that, we also ought to love one another.

12.verse: No one has ever seen God. If we love one another, God abides in us, and his love has achieved its goal in us.

13.verse: By this we know that we abide in God and he in us: because he has given us of his Spirit.

14.verse: And we have seen and testify that the Father has sent his Son as the Savior of the world.

15.verse: If anyone confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God abides in him and he in God.

16.verse: And we have come to know and to trust the love that God has for us. God is love, and the one who abides in love abides in God, and God abides in him.

17.verse: By this, love is fully realized among us, so that we may have confidence in the day of judgment; because just as he is, so also are we in this world.

18.verse: There is no fear in love, but perfect love drives out fear because fear has to do with punishment. So the one who fears has not been perfected in love.

19.verse: We love because he first loved us.

20.verse: If someone says, “I love God,” yet hates his brother, he is a liar; for the one who does not love his brother whom he has seen, cannot love God whom he has not seen.

21.verse: And the commandment we have from him is this: the one who loves God must also love his brother.

1.verse: Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ has been born of God, and everyone who loves the father loves his child.

2.verse: By this we know that we love the children of God: whenever we love God and obey his commandments.

3.verse: For this is the love of God: that we keep his commandments. And his commandments are not burdensome,

4.verse: because everyone who has been born of God conquers the world. And this is the victorious power that has conquered the world—our faith.

5.verse: Who is it that conquers the world, but the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?

6.verse: This is the one who came by water and blood—Jesus Christ; not by water only but by water and blood. And the Spirit is the one who testifies, because the Spirit is the truth.

7.verse: For there are three that testify:

8.verse: the Spirit and the water and the blood; and the three are in accord.

9.verse: If we receive the testimony of men, the testimony of God is greater, because this is the testimony of God that he has borne concerning his Son.

10.verse: The one who believes in the Son of God has the testimony in himself; the one who does not believe God has made him out to be a liar, because he has not believed in the testimony that God has borne concerning his Son.

11.verse: And this is the testimony: God gave us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.

12.verse: The one who has the Son has life; the one who does not have the Son of God does not have life.

13.verse: I am writing these things to you so that you may know that you have eternal life—you who believe in the name of the Son of God.

14.verse: And this is the confidence we have as we approach him: that if we ask anything according to his will, he hears us.

15.verse: And if we know that he hears us regarding whatever we ask, we know that we have the requests that we have asked of him.

16.verse: If someone sees his brother committing a sin that does not lead to death, he should ask and God will give him life—to those whose sins do not lead to death. There is sin that leads to death; I do not say that he should pray about that.

17.verse: All wrongdoing is sin, but there is sin that does not lead to death.

18.verse: We know that everyone who has been born of God does not continue to sin, but the one who was born of God protects him and the evil one will not harm him.

19.verse: We know that we are children of God, and that the whole world lies in the power of the evil one.

20.verse: And we know that the Son of God has come and has given us discernment so that we may know him who is true; and we are in him who is true, in his Son Jesus Christ. This one is the true God and eternal life.

21.verse: Little children, keep yourselves from idols.
